default: 150g/5½oz self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting
100g/3½oz Dorset Blue Vinny cheese, or other blue cheese, crumbled
1 tbsp chopped fresh parsley, to serve

steps: Place the flour, baking powder and cheese into a food processor and pulse to combine.
In a separate bowl, mix together the milk, yoghurt and oil. With the motor running, gradually add this mixture to the food processor until a dough is formed, adding more milk if necessary to bind.
Turn the dough out and knead briefly on a floured surface. Roll out to about 2.5cm/1in thick.
Heat an ovenproof griddle pan until hot and melt the butter in the pan. Cut out discs of the dough with a pastry cutter and fry on one side until golden-brown.
Transfer the pan to the oven and continue to cook until risen and golden-brown on top, about 7-8 minutes.
Serve the scones on a board, scattered with parsley.
title: Hot Blue Vinny griddle scones
